Text: O LORD, how my foes have increased! How many rise up against me!
Context: David expresses distress over the number of his enemies.

Text: Many say of me, ”God will not deliver him.“ Selah
Context: David relays the words of his doubters who believe God will not save him.

Text: But You, O LORD, are a shield around me, my glory, and the One who lifts my head.
Context: David affirms his confidence in God as his protector and the source of his honor.

Text: To the LORD I cry aloud, and He answers me from His holy hill. Selah
Context: David recalls crying out to God and receiving a response, illustrating his close relationship with God.

Text: I lie down and sleep; I wake again, for the LORD sustains me.
Context: Expressing trust in God, David explains that he can rest peacefully because of God’s support.

Text: I will not fear the tens of thousands drawn up against me on every side.
Context: David‘s faith gives him courage despite being outnumbered by his enemies.

Text: Arise, O LORD! Save me, O my God! For You strike all my enemies on the cheek; You shatter the teeth of the wicked.
Context: David calls upon God to act and asserts his belief in God’s power to defeat his enemies.

Text: Salvation belongs to the LORD; Your blessing is on Your people. Selah
Context: David concludes with a statement of faith that God owns salvation and blesses His people, offering a final reflection.
